title: Sri Lanka schedules power cut of 3 hour 20 min for April 28
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Power cuts of 3 hours and 20 minutes have been approved for Sri Lanka for April 28, Public Utilities Commission Chairman Janaka Ratnayake said as forex shortages due to money printing by the central bank triggered forex shortages disrupting fuel imports.
On April 28, all areas (ABCDEFGHIJKLPQRSTUVW) will have power cuts of 2 hours from 0900am to 0500pm and 1 hour and 20 minutes from 0500pm and 0900pm.
CEB said the duration may be reduced by 30 minutes either at the beginning or end of the slot.
Between 0600am and 0900am, the Colombo City centre could face power cut of three hours.
